page.title: 16ECOLOGY
page.content: All the local farmhouses are built of sandstone.This soft sedimentary rock is found all around. The soil is very fertile and farming has been carried out here for centuries. At the back of{Clay Lane Farm}are the remains of a kiln which was used to make clay pipes.Beneath the topsoil lies the clay, which would have been used in the pottery industry. Some of the fields are 6' lower than others because of{Pilkington's} removing the sand for their{glass {industry.} There are several small streams and brooks in this area,especially in{ {Chain Acre Wood.}The largest of these is{Mill Brook.}This runs through { {Howards Farm.}
